description.narrative: The objective of the Sustainable Development Investment Project is to support the design and implementation of policy reforms and related investments in line with the Sustainable Development DPL Program framework, particularly those policies and plans that address environmental problems affecting the quality of life and wellbeing of the Colombian population. In particular, the project will support (i) the incorporation of environmental considerations in the policies of the sectors that result in a high cost of environmental degradation (e.g., health, transport, and water); (ii) the implementation of policy measures for integrated water resource management; (iii) the optimization of urban development policy instruments to improve urban quality of life; and (iv) the strengthening of the planning, monitoring, and oversight of national, regional and local environmental management and policies. By supporting these objectives, the project is expected to help alleviate the effects of environmental degradation on the most vulnerable segments of the population, particularly children who are typically the most affected by this degradation, through improvements in public health and quality of life. These improvements will be supported through reductions in air and water pollution, as well as through improved hygiene and urban environmental management.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :2.03 | Description :Closing date | Due Date :31-Oct-2012

Finance Agreement :3.04 | Description :Maintain an implementation system within MAVDT, responsible for overall projectcoordination, implementation, m & e, and with a str ucture, functions and responsibilities acceptable to the Bank. | Frequency:Yearly

Finance Agreement :3.05 (b) | Description :Furnish implementation report about March 31 of each year, integrating results of m & eactivities on progress achieved in carrying out project during period preceeding date of report. | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :3.05 (d) | Description :Mid-term review carried out, jointly with Bank by not later than November 30, 2007. |Due Date :30-Nov-2007

Finance Agreement :3.07 (a) | Description :Not later than March 31 of each year, furnish operational plan for following calendaryear specifying activities to be financed from loan proceeds during the respective calendar year. | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :3.09 (a) | Description :MAVDT shall establish written arrangements among implementing entities, satisfactory tothe Bank, including obligation of each entit y. | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :3.10 (A) | Description :MAVDT SHALL ENTER INTO A MANAGEMENT SUPPORT AGREEMENT WITH AN ADMINISTRATOR,SATISFACTORY TO THE BANK TO MAINTAIN RECORDS AND ACCOUN | Due Date :28-Dec-2005
Finance Agreement :4.01 (b) | Description :Audit report of project financial statements submitted no later than six months afterthe end of each fiscal year. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :4.02 (b) | Description :Financial monitoring report, setting forth sources and uses of proejct funds, furnishedno later than 45 days after the end of eachcalendar semester. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section E | Description :Safeguards:MADS, DNP and IDEAM shall carry out the project implementationin accordance with the ESMF and shall not modify the ESMF without the prior written agreement of the Bank.MADS, IDEAM and DNPshall ensure that the terms of reference for any consultancies related to any technical assistance provided [...] are satisfactoryto the Bank and [...] consistent with safeguard policies | Frequency :Monthly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.A.2 | Description :MADS, DNP and IDEAM shall maintain an implementation system responsiblefor overall project planning, coordination, implementation,supervision, monitoring and evaluation, and with staff, a structure,functions and responsibilities acceptable to the Bank. | Frequency :Monthly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.A.3 | Description :MADS shall, no later than April 30, 2012, update its financial andadministrative procedures with respect to the Project, in a manner satisfactory to the Bank. | Due Date :17-Aug-2012

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.B.1 | Description :MADS shall execute written Inter-Institutional Arrangements among theProject Implementing Entities, on terms and conditions satisfactory to the Bank, and in compliance with the obligations containedin the Loan Agreement. | Due Date :21-Aug-2012

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section IV.B.1 (c) | Description :No withdrawal shall be made for payments under Categories (3) and(6), until IDEAM has hired a financial management specialist and a procurement specialist with qualifications and experience andunder terms of reference, all satisfactory to the Bank. | Due Date :23-May-2013

Finance Agreement :Section 5.01 | Description :The Inter-Institutional Arrangements have been duly executed by the respectiveparties thereto, in a manner satisfactory to the Bank. | Due Date :21-Aug-2012

title.narrative: Five laboratories accredited to conduct water quality monitoring.
Regulations developed to support implementation of Water Law
Networks in operation with data generated from network used to produce unified report on air quality

baseline.value: 2 AQM monitoring networks in operation. None reporting to central repository and none measuring PM2.5.

title.narrative: Strengthening of MADS in the area of monitoring of environmental management and sustainable development indicators

baseline.value: Platform of monitoring indicators in the initial phase of development.

target.value: Monitoring and evaluation module on MDGs as part of SIAC portal.

actual.value: MADS compiles a report on 25 environmental management indicators based on information provided by 33 CARs.The most recent reportwas dated 2013. The indicators reported by the CARs are also published on the SIAC portal.Sustainable development indicators arenot being monitored by MADS.

title.narrative: Strengthened air quality monitoring and health information systems

baseline.value: Zero homologation center and Unified Environmental health Information Systems (SUISA).

target.value: One homologation center and one SUISA fully operational.

title.narrative: Improved functioning of SINA to set priorities related to sustainable development and achieve key results for the second and third phases of the SusDevDPL Program.

baseline.value: National policies approved on water and air quality and environmental health. The parent Project, accompanied the SustainableDevelopment DPL program that supported the passage of the Fuel Quality Law and the creation of CONAIRE. The Project also financedthe establishment of emissions monitoring protocols, emissions inventories, and environmental health studies of air quality in themost polluted sites.

target.value: Significant improvement of the monitoring of water and air quality, information systems, and capacity to implement environmentalregulations and policies

actual.value: The project has not supported the monitoring of water qualty or air quality systems linked with the MDGs. Although there ismonitoring of some 25 environmental management indicators, it is in contrast to the status of monitoring related to MDGs. TheNational Department of Planning generates a report on MDGs with most recent being for 2013. With respect to the MDG #7 onenvironmental sustainability, only one indicator - on reforestation - is reported. There is no monitoring or reporting on air andwater linked with MDGs. Evidence that environmental information gathered is used to update decrees and other regulations is notreadily apparent.

title.narrative: Monitoring and evaluation system established and operational, measuring progress on achievement of MDG-based indicators.

target.value: Procedures for reporting the status of monitoring indicators developed and agreed to by environmental authorities. Operation of M&Esystem underway.

actual.value: Progress on MDG-based indicators in relation to to air, water and land systems not being monitored.

title.narrative: Strengthening ofthe CARs in the implementation of the Single Information System on Natural Resources Use (SIUR) for themanufacturing sector

target.value: 10 CARs with the strategies implemented, data processed and analysis of the indicators.

actual.value: IDEAM has provided training and technical assistance to 27 CARs and 30 manufacturing business groups to facilitate theimplementation of the SIUR in the manufacturing sector. The SIUR in the manufacturing sector is being piloted in 8 environmentalauthorities.

title.narrative: Strengthening of the DNP in the area of environmental management

target.value: The instruments and strategies include the following: (i) 4 technical instruments to support the formulation of the disaster riskmanagement stategies; (ii) one strategy for the management of environmental information, and (iii) 2 institutional strategies forthe dissemination of Integrated Water Resources Management Information.

actual.value: DNP has consolidated the design of an information system to provide inputs to the design of environmental policy.Two documents havebeen produced on methodologies for structuring the country's environmental information at the sectoral and regional levels.

title.narrative: Strengthening water resources management through pilot projects on aquifer management legalization of water use management of climate risks.
Accomplishment of at least three of the six sustainable development objectives established in the three-year action plans (Decree 1200 of 2004)
Reach and acceptance of handwashing with soap messages among the target population of the benefits of handwashing with soap, compared with baseline.
Improved incorporation of national environmental priorities and environmental variables in sectoral policies, through increased useof SEA and other instruments

actual.value: 2 SEAs for environmental health, biofuels were conducted. The SEA on environmental health was used to inform the development ofguidelines for a national strategy on environmental health approved by CONPES 3550 of 2008.

title.narrative: Technical assistance provided to 200 municipalities to support closure of open dumps
Strengthening environmental norms and regulations and implementation capacity
Communication of project results to civil society

actual.value: Project information is not available on the webpage for MADS.

title.narrative: Strengthening of the water resources monitoring network and the implementation of a water resources information system (SIRH)

target.value: All equipment installed and operational; and three SIRH applications developed.

actual.value: Zero water resources monitoring equipment installed; 6 SIRH modules developed and operational

title.narrative: Behavioral change (i.e., increase in handwashing at key times) compared to baselines
Regulations developed supporting Urban Development Law, in particular preventing human settlements in areas at risk.
